articles.author: Block Experts
articles.description:
üõ°Ô∏è How I Resolved the ‚ÄúMalicious App‚Äù Warning on Phantom Wallet Extension


If you're building a dApp or browser extension that interacts with the Phantom Wallet, and you've seen your app flagged as malicious, you‚Äôre not alone. i got the same on my token manager Dapp Solana token manager
I recently ran into this issue, and after some debugging and a successful resolution, I thought I‚Äôd share my experience. If you're seeing similar warnings and want to remove the "malicious app" label, here's how to go about it.
Phantom Wallet sometimes flags apps or extensions that interact with wallets in an unsafe or suspicious way. This can happen if:
You manually sign and send transactions using raw methods.
You bypass Phantom's secure APIs.
Your code behaves like a phishing attack (even if unintentionally).
This results in a scary warning for users, which harms trust and adoption.
signAndSendTransaction


The key is to use Phantom‚Äôs secure APIs correctly. Specifically, instead of signing and sending transactions manually like this:
const signedTransaction = await signTransaction(transaction);
const txId = await connection.sendRawTransaction(signedTransaction.serialize());
await connection.confirmTransaction(txId, 'confirmed');

Switch to Phantom‚Äôs recommended helper method:
 const provider = getProvider();
  const { signature } = await provider.signAndSendTransaction(transaction);
  await connection.getSignatureStatus(signature);

üîí Why this works
üìß Still Flagged? Request a Manual Review
‚úâÔ∏è Email: review@phantom.app
Your project name
GitHub or website URL
Code snippets showing secure API usage
‚úÖ Checklist to Avoid Being Flagged
Use signAndSendTransaction instead of raw signing/sending.
Avoid modifying the transaction structure after signing.
Do not inject hidden fields or overwrite wallet methods.
Don‚Äôt request excessive permissions.
Make your code open-source if possible (helps with review).
articles.title: How I Resolved the ‚ÄúMalicious App‚Äù Warning on Phantom Wallet Extension

articles.author: Omri Luz
articles.description:
Best Practices for Async Error Handling in JavaScript


JavaScript has undergone significant evolution since its inception in 1995, transitioning from a simple scripting language primarily designed for client-side web interactivity to a powerhouse of modern web application development. With the rise of asynchronous programming, particularly with the introduction of Promises and async/await patterns, JavaScript has transformed how developers write non-blocking code. However, this evolution has also introduced complexities, especially in error handling within asynchronous contexts. This article aims to provide a deep, nuanced exploration of async error handling best practices, supported by historical context, technical specifications, and real-world applications.
JavaScript‚Äôs asynchronous ca‚Ä¶
articles.title: Best Practices for Async Error Handling in JavaScript

articles.author: Mikuz
articles.description:
In recent years, IoT and Big Data technologies have revolutionized the agriculture sector, giving rise to the concept of smart farming. By integrating connected sensors and advanced data analytics, farmers can optimize crop yields, conserve resources, and respond to environmental challenges with unprecedented precision. This digital transformation is crucial to meet the growing global food demand while promoting sustainable farming practices.
IoT devices in agriculture include soil moisture sensors, weather stations, drones, and GPS-enabled equipment. These devices continuously collect real-time data on soil conditions, temperature, humidity, pest presence, and plant health. This granular data allows farmers to monitor crop environments closely and adjust practices dynamically, reducing gu‚Ä¶
articles.title: Enhancing Agriculture with IoT and Big Data: A New Era of Smart Farming

articles.author: M√∫sicas Sertanejas IA
articles.description:
An in-depth analysis of how AI is transforming the music industry and democratizing artistic creation


Music has always been considered one of the purest expressions of human creativity. From the first primitive drums to complex orchestral symphonies, musical art has been shaped by human imagination, emotion, and technique. However, we are experiencing a silent revolution that is fundamentally redefining how we think about music creation: the rise of Artificial Intelligence.

This transformation isn't just a technological curiosity or academic experiment. It's a paradigmatic shift that is democratizing music creation, offering new tools for established artists and opening doors for creators who previously lacked access to traditional music production resources.
AI's journey in music began‚Ä¶
articles.title: The AI Revolution in Music Creation: How Technology is Redefining the Art of Sound

articles.title: Your software is lying to you

articles.author: Mikuz
articles.description:
In today's data-driven business landscape, conversational analytics is revolutionizing how organizations interact with their data. Instead of relying on complex SQL queries, static dashboards, or technical teams, users can now access insights through natural language conversations. This breakthrough, powered by generative AI and sophisticated multi-agent systems, transforms simple questions into actionable business intelligence. The technology enables immediate, intuitive data exploration across various sources, from traditional databases to unstructured text, making advanced analytics accessible to users at all technical levels.
Conversational analytics represents a significant advancement in business intelligence, allowing users to interact with complex data systems through natural langu‚Ä¶
articles.title: Conversational Analytics: Revolutionizing Data Interaction

articles.author: arafatruetbd
articles.description:
If you‚Äôve ever worked on more than one Node.js project, chances are you‚Äôve run into the dreaded ‚ÄúWrong Node version‚Äù problem. One app needs Node v10, another uses v18, and suddenly you‚Äôre uninstalling and reinstalling Node.js every 15 minutes.
Yeah. It sucks.
The good news? There‚Äôs a much better way to manage this. It‚Äôs called NVM (Node Version Manager) ‚Äî and yes, it works on Windows too! üôå
Let me show you how to set it up.
If you already have Node.js installed, go ahead and remove it. NVM will take care of installing and managing Node for you.
Open the Control Panel

Go to Programs ‚Üí Uninstall a program

Find Node.js, right-click it, and choose Uninstall




This step helps avoid conflicts down the line.
Now grab the Windows version of NVM from the official GitHub repo:
üëâ Download NVM for Windows
Scroll to the latest release
Download the file called nvm-setup.exe

Run the installer
Just follow the prompts:
Leave the default install path (or pick your own)
It‚Äôll ask for the Node.js installation path ‚Äî again, the default is fine
Finish the setup
Boom. NVM is now installed.
Open a new terminal window (PowerShell or Command Prompt) and type:
nvm version

If you see a version number, you‚Äôre all set!
Let‚Äôs test it out.
nvm install 16.20.0

Want Node v10 for an old project?
nvm install 10.12.0

nvm use 16.20.0

That‚Äôs it. Now when you run:
node -v

You‚Äôll see the version you just switched to.
nvm list

nvm uninstall 10.12.0

If nvm doesn‚Äôt work right away, restart your terminal (or open it as Admin).
Every version of Node you install via NVM is isolated ‚Äî which means your global packages won‚Äôt carry over.

Want to go back to the system-installed Node? Just type:




  nvm off

NVM is honestly one of the best tools you can install as a Node developer. It saves time, reduces headaches, and makes working on multiple projects way smoother.
No more uninstalling Node every week. No more version errors. Just run the version you need and get back to coding.
Happy hacking! üíª‚ö°
articles.title: How to Install NVM on Windows (And Why You‚Äôll Love It)

articles.author: Joao Dalbem
articles.description:
What Is Postmark and Why Use It?
Why choose Postmark?
High Deliverability: Postmark‚Äôs specialized infrastructure ensures your emails reach inboxes, not spam.
User-Friendly Interface: Manage email templates, recipients, and logs all through an easy-to-use dashboard.
Templates and Personalization: Create beautiful, professional email templates with customizable fields.
Real-Time Tracking: See when emails are opened or if they bounce.
Step 1: Sign Up and Set Up Your Postmark Account
Once inside, create a ‚ÄúServer‚Äù ‚Äî think of this as your workspace for all the emails related to your project or app.
Step 2: Create Your Email Templates
Templates can include personalized fields like user names, order numbers, or dates to make emails feel custom and professional.
No HTML or design skills? No problem ‚Äî Postmark provides easy tools and guides.
Step 3: Connect Postmark to Your Application or Tools
For example, you can connect Postmark to your CRM or helpdesk so that emails automatically send when a user submits a form or places an order.
Use services like Zapier to ‚Äúbridge‚Äù apps and trigger email notifications based on specific events.
Step 4: Manage and Monitor Your Emails
If emails fail to deliver, Postmark provides clear insights so you can quickly resolve issues.
You can also set up alerts for any important events, ensuring you stay on top of your communication.
Step 5: Keep Your Email Sending Reputation Strong
Maintaining a good sending reputation means your emails land reliably in inboxes.
Why This Matters
With Postmark‚Äôs no-code tools and integrations, you can quickly set up a professional email notification system without needing a developer or writing any code.
Ready to Get Started?
Simply sign up for Postmark, create your templates, connect your apps, and start sending beautiful, timely emails that your users will appreciate ‚Äî all without touching a line of code.
articles.title: How to Build an Email Notification System Using Postmark (No Coding Needed)

articles.author: Emma(minjoo)
articles.description:
Tree


A tree is a data structure composed of nodes.
Each tree has a root node -> Actually a root node isn't necessary in graph theory, but it's usually how we use trees in programming.
Root node has zero or more child nodes. Each child node has zero or more child nodes, and so on
The tree cannot contain cytcles. The nodes may or may not be in a particular order, they could ahve any data type as values, and they may or may not have links back to their parent nodes.
Binary Tree vs. Binary search Tree
A binary search tree is a binary tree in which every node fits a specific ordering property
->All left descendents <= n < all right descendents. This must be true for each node n

The definition of a binary search tree can vary slightly with respect to equality. Under some definitions, the tree‚Ä¶
articles.title: Data Structure - Tree

articles.author: Joao Dalbem
articles.description:
Stop chasing perfection.


Learn in focused sprints, not marathons.


Build real projects‚Äîeven small ones.


Protect your passion.


Avoid comparing your pace to others.


Take care of your body and mind.


Know when to unplug.



You don‚Äôt master programming in a week. It‚Äôs not a sprint. It‚Äôs a craft you grow into‚Äîlayer by layer, line by line. Burnout won‚Äôt get you there faster. But a sustainable rhythm? That will.
Keep building, keep breathing, and keep going.
articles.title: üöÄ How to Master Coding Without Burning Out üß†üî• (My Experience)

articles.author: Dan Higgins
articles.description:
üìö Table of Contents



The Real World Problem
Today‚Äôs Mission
Commands I Used (and promptly typo'd the first three times)
RHCSA Objectives Covered
What I Learned Today
Real Life Analogy Time
Tomorrow‚Äôs Challenge Teaser

"Why is this user part of six different groups? Are they building servers or starting a band?"
If you've ever stared at the output of groups and thought,
"Wait, what even is a 'secondary group'?"

Understand primary vs secondary groups (like best friends vs group chats you're stuck in)


Create groups manually


Add users to one or more groups


View group membership


Remove users from groups without deleting the group or starting a system-wide rebellion





Bonus spell: see all groups on the system:


Create and manage groups


Manage user group memberships


Understand primary and secondary group differences


Use commands like usermod, groupadd, groupdel, and gpasswd




The primary group is like your day job. The secondary groups are your side hustles.


usermod -aG is your friend ‚Äî forget the -a and you accidentally wipe all other group memberships 


getent group feels like snooping on everyone‚Äôs backstage passes




If users are people in a company, then groups are:
devops_team ‚Äì who gets access to deploy


finance ‚Äì who sees the money stuff


lunch_club ‚Äì okay this one‚Äôs unofficial but still important



Assign wisely. Because one wrong group and suddenly ‚ÄúSusan from HR‚Äù has root access to /var/www.

‚ÄúWait‚Ä¶ I thought that file belonged to me?‚Äù
Day 4 is all about ownership, permissions, and why chown is a blessing and a curse.
What‚Äôs your weirdest group name on your Linux box?
Mine‚Äôs kettlegang. Long story. 


  
  
  RHCSA #LinuxAdminLife #UserGroupDrama #30DaysChallenge #BeginnerToBoss #SysadminChronicles #RHEL9 #CommandLineConfidence #DevTo #KeepLearning #RealWorldRHCSA
articles.title: Day 3 of #30DaysRHCSAChallenge ‚Äì Group Therapy (For Users, Not Me... Mostly)
